name: Arberry
text: Blessed be He who has sent down the Salvation upon His servant, that he may be a warner to all beings;

name: Arberry
text: to whom belongs the Kingdom of the heavens and the earth; and He has not taken to Him a son, and He has no associate in the Kingdom; and He created every thing, then He ordained it very exactly.

name: Arberry
text: Yet they have taken to them gods, apart from Him, that create nothing and themselves are created, and have no power to hurt or profit themselves, no power of death or life or raising up.

name: Arberry
text: The unbelievers say, 'This is naught but a calumny he has forged, and other folk have helped him to it.' So they have committed wrong and falsehood.

name: Arberry
text: They say, 'Fairy-tales of the ancients that he has had written down, so that they are recited to him at the dawn and in the evening.'

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'He sent it down, who knows the secret in the heavens and earth; He is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.'

name: Arberry
text: They also say, 'What ails this Messenger that he eats food, and goes in the markets? Why has an angel not been sent down to him, to be a warner with him?

name: Arberry
text: Or why is not a treasure thrown to him, or why has he not a Garden to eat of?' The evildoers say, 'You are only following a man bewitched!'

name: Arberry
text: Behold, how they strike similitudes for thee, and go astray, and are unable to find a way!

name: Arberry
text: Blessed be He who, if He will, shall assign to them better than that -- gardens underneath which rivers flow, and he shall assign to thee palaces.

name: Arberry
text: Nay, but they cry lies to the Hour; and We have prepared for him who cries lies to the Hour a Blaze.

name: Arberry
text: When it sees them from a far place, they shall hear its bubbling and sighing.

name: Arberry
text: And when they are cast, coupled in fetters, into a narrow place of that Fire, they will call out there for destruction.

name: Arberry
text: 'Call not out today for one destruction, but call for many!'

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'Is that better, or the Garden of Eternity, that is promised to the godfearing, and is their recompense and homecoming?'

name: Arberry
text: Therein they shall have what they will dwelling forever; it is a promise binding upon thy Lord, and of Him to be required.

name: Arberry
text: Upon the day when He shall muster them and that they serve, apart from God, and He shall say, 'Was it you that led these My servants astray, or did they themselves err from the way?'

name: Arberry
text: They shall 'Glory be to Thee! It did not behove us to take unto say, ourselves protectors apart from Thee; but Thou gavest them and their fathers enjoyment of days, until they forgot

name: Arberry
text: the Remembrance, and were a people corrupt.' So they cried lies touching the things you say, and you can neither turn it aside, nor find any help. Whosoever of you does evil, We shall let him taste a great chastisement.

name: Arberry
text: And We sent not before thee any Envoys, but that they ate food, and went in the markets; and We appointed some of you to be a trial for others: 'Will you endure?' Thy Lord is ever All-seeing.

name: Arberry
text: Say those who look not to encounter Us, 'Why have the angels not been sent down on us, or why see we not our Lord?' Waxed proud they have within them, and become greatly disdainful.

name: Arberry
text: Upon the day that they see the angels, no good tidings that day for the sinners; they shall say, 'A ban forbidden!'

name: Arberry
text: We shall advance upon what work they have done, and make it a scattered dust.

name: Arberry
text: The inhabitants of Paradise that day, better shall be their lodging, fairer their resting-place.

name: Arberry
text: Upon the day that heaven is split asunder with the clouds and the angels are sent down in majesty,

name: Arberry
text: the Kingdom that day, the true Kingdom, shall belong to the All-merciful and it shall be a day harsh for the unbelievers.

name: Arberry
text: Upon the day the evildoer shall bite his hands, saying, 'Would that I had taken a way along with the Messenger!

name: Arberry
text: Alas, would that I had not taken So-and-so for a friend!

name: Arberry
text: He indeed led me astray from the Remembrance, after it had come to me; Satan is ever a forsaker of men.'

name: Arberry
text: The Messenger says, 'O my Lord, behold, my people have taken this Koran as a thing to be shunned.'

name: Arberry
text: Even so We have appointed to every Prophet an enemy among the sinners; but thy Lord suffices as a guide and as a helper.

name: Arberry
text: The unbelievers say, 'Why has the Koran not been sent down upon him all at once?' Even so, that We may strengthen thy heart thereby, and We have chanted it very distinctly.

name: Arberry
text: They bring not to thee any similitude but that We bring thee the truth, and better in exposition.

name: Arberry
text: Those who shall be mustered to Gehenna upon their faces -- they shall be worse in place, and gone further astray from the way.

name: Arberry
text: We gave Moses the Book, and appointed with him his brother Aaron as minister

name: Arberry
text: and We said, 'Go to the people who have cried lies to Our signs'; then We destroyed them utterly.

name: Arberry
text: And the people of Noah, when they cried lies to the Messengers, We drowned them, and made them to be a sign to mankind; and We have prepared for the evildoers a painful chastisement.

name: Arberry
text: And Ad, and Thamood, and the men of Er-Rass, and between that generations a many,

name: Arberry
text: for each We struck similitudes, and each We ruined utterly.

name: Arberry
text: Surely they have come by the city that was rained on by an evil rain; what, have they not seen it? Nay, but they look for no upraising.

name: Arberry
text: And when they see thee, they take thee in mockery only: 'What, is this he whom God sent forth as a Messenger?

name: Arberry
text: Wellnigh he had led us astray from our gods, but that we kept steadfast to them.' Assuredly they shall know, when they see the chastisement, who is further astray from the way.

name: Arberry
text: Hast thou seen him who has taken his caprice to be his god? Wilt thou be a guardian over them?

name: Arberry
text: Or deemest thou that most of them hear or understand? They are but as the cattle; nay, they are further astray from the way.

name: Arberry
text: Hast thou not regarded thy Lord, how He has stretched out the shadow? Had He willed, He would have made it still. Then We appointed the sun, to be a guide to it;

name: Arberry
text: thereafter We seize it to Ourselves, drawing it gently.

name: Arberry
text: It is He who appointed the night for you to be a garment and sleep for a rest, and day He appointed for a rising.

name: Arberry
text: And it is He who has loosed the winds, bearing good tidings before His mercy; and We sent down from heaven pure water

name: Arberry
text: so that We might revive a dead land, and give to drink of it, of that We created, cattle and men a many.

name: Arberry
text: We have indeed turned it about amongst them, so that they may remember; yet most men refuse all but unbelief.

name: Arberry
text: If We had willed, We would have raised up in every city a warner.

name: Arberry
text: So obey not the unbelievers, but struggle with them thereby mightily.

name: Arberry
text: And it is He who let forth the two seas, this one Sweet, grateful to taste, and this salt, bitter to the tongue, and He set between them a barrier, and a ban forbidden.

name: Arberry
text: And it is He who created of water a mortal, and made him kindred of blood and marriage; thy Lord is All-powerful.

name: Arberry
text: And they serve, apart from God, what neither profits them nor hurts them; and the unbeliever is ever a partisan against his Lord.

name: Arberry
text: We have sent thee not, except good tidings to bear, and warning.

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'I do not ask of you a wage for this, except for him who wishes to take to his Lord a way.'

name: Arberry
text: Put thy trust in the Living God, the Undying, and proclaim His praise. Sufficiently is He aware of His servants sins

name: Arberry
text: who created the heavens and the earth, and what between them is, in six days, then sat Himself upon the Throne, the All-compassionate: ask any informed of Him!

name: Arberry
text: But when they are told, 'Bow yourselves to the All-merciful,' they say, 'And what is the All-merciful? Shall we bow ourselves to what thou biddest us?' And it increases them in aversion.

name: Arberry
text: Blessed be He who has set in heaven constellations, and has set among them a lamp, and an illuminating moon.

name: Arberry
text: And it is He who made the night and day a succession for whom He desires to remember or He desires to be thankful.

name: Arberry
text: The servants of the All-merciful are those who walk in the earth modestly and who, when the ignorant address them, say, 'Peace';

name: Arberry
text: who pass the night prostrate to their Lord and standing;

name: Arberry
text: who say, 'Our Lord, turn Thou from us the chastisement of Gehenna; surely its chastisement is torment most terrible;

name: Arberry
text: evil it is as a lodging-place and an abode';

name: Arberry
text: who, when they expend, are neither prodigal nor parsimonious, but between that is a just stand;

name: Arberry
text: who call not upon another god with God, nor slay the soul God has forbidden except by right, neither fornicate, for whosoever does that shall meet the price

name: Arberry
text: of sin-doubled shall be the chastisement for him on the Resurrection Day, and he shall dwell therein humbled,

name: Arberry
text: save him who repents, and believes, and does righteous work -- those, God will change their evil deeds into good deeds, for God is ever All-forgiving, All-compassionate;

name: Arberry
text: and whosoever repents, and does righteousness, he truly turns to God in repentance.

name: Arberry
text: And those who bear not false witness and, when they pass by idle talk, pass by with dignity;

name: Arberry
text: who, when they are reminded of the signs of their Lord, fall not down thereat deaf and blind;

name: Arberry
text: who say, 'Our Lord, give us refreshment of our wives and seed, and make us a model to the godfearing.'

name: Arberry
text: Those shall be recompensed with the highest heaven, for that they endured patiently, and they shall receive therein a greeting and --' Peace!'

name: Arberry
text: Therein they shall dwell forever; fair it is as a lodging-place and an abode.

name: Arberry
text: Say: 'My Lord esteems you not at all were it not for your prayer, for you have cried lies, and it shall surely be fastened.'
